https://api.spoonacular.com/recipes/6579.title: Ravioli With Arugula, Pine Nuts, Raisins & Cream
https://api.spoonacular.com/recipes/6579.summary: The recipe Ravioli With Arugula, Pine Nuts, Raisins & Cream could satisfy your Mediterranean craving in roughly 45 minutes. This recipe serves 2 and costs $3.16 per serving. This main course has 884 calories, 29g of protein, and 52g of fat per serving. It is brought to you by Foodista. A mixture of pine nuts, olive oil, cream, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 52%, which is good. Similar recipes are Spinach With Pine Nuts & Raisins, Spinach with Pine Nuts and Raisins, and Spinach with Pine Nuts and Raisins.

winePairing.pairingText: Ravioli on the menu? Try pairing with Chianti, Verdicchio, and Trebbiano. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. The Brancaia Chianti Classico Riserva with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 38 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Brancaia Chianti Classico Riserva
productMatches.description:
This Chianti Classico Riserva shows tropical and black fruit aromas, with notes of nut and almond on the palate. Crafted with the finest Sangiovese grapes from two of our estate vineyards, Brancaia Estate and Poppi Vineyard, this wine has a dense, ruby-red color and a long, aromatic finish.
Blend: 80% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot

https://api.spoonacular.com/recipes/6579.instructions: Boil enough water to cook the ravioli in a medium-sized pot.  Once the water has come to a boil, drop in the ravioli and cook it for the 4-6 minutes that is usually required for fresh ravioli.  Obviously, you will need longer if using dried ravioli.  When there are about 4 minutes left in the ravioli cooking time, warm the olive oil to medium heat in a large pan.  Add the pine nuts and saut them for about a minute.  Add the garlic and saut for another minute.  Make sure that it does not brown.  Then, add the raisins and arugula and stir for 20 to 30 seconds.  Once most of the arugula has begun to wilt, add the cream and simmer for 1 minute.  Remove from heat.  Drain the ravioli, place them in a bowl, and top with the arugula

steps.step: Boil enough water to cook the ravioli in a medium-sized pot.  Once the water has come to a boil, drop in the ravioli and cook it for the 4-6 minutes that is usually required for fresh ravioli.  Obviously, you will need longer if using dried ravioli.  When there are about 4 minutes left in the ravioli cooking time, warm the olive oil to medium heat in a large pan.
Add the pine nuts and saut them for about a minute.

Add the garlic and saut for another minute.  Make sure that it does not brown.  Then, add the raisins and arugula and stir for 20 to 30 seconds.  Once most of the arugula has begun to wilt, add the cream and simmer for 1 minute.
Drain the ravioli, place them in a bowl, and top with the arugula
